page.title: 02BRICKYARD AT THORNEYWOOD
page.content: Thorneywood is the area around my school.In 1068 it was just a thorny wood-part of Sherwood Forest.Later the king's red and fallow deer were kept there.Fire and the enclosures act of 1797 reduced the woods and destroyed the deer.For a long time the area was open cultivated fields.Later still a brickworks was established and existed until the mid-1960's.By 1919 many houses were being built and people had more facilities.1967 brought the last major change.A bungalow estate brought back memories for those who had played on the football pitch that was the site.A friendly community came and stayed in 1973,and the area is now completely residential.Life centres on the homes,shops and pub.Everyone receives a cheery welcome in the shops,even if they are strangers. -Emma Speziale(11).
